column4: Do I need to install a SMP kernel or something? Top is only showing use on one of my processors.
what release of ubuntu?
dapper
you need the 686 kerne;
linux-686-smp - Complete Linux kernel on PPro/Celeron/PII/PIII/PIV SMP.   ?
yep
that works for Xeons ?
on edgy and later the kernel is called generic and has smp by defaut
should do, yes
good info. thanks.
do i have to modify my grub menu.lst ?
no, installing the kernel sh9ould do so automatically
im running off that kernel now, but mysql still seems to only be using one processor. top shows 1 processor taking the whole load.
what does cat /proc/cpuinfo give?
four processors...alld Intel Xeon CPU 4.00GHz
then the are all recognisedand should be working :)
it showed all four before I installed that kernel though.
/proc/cpuinfo  always shows the hardware...but not if the linux kernel is using it.
uname -a   shows  2.6.15-27-686 #1 SMP PREEMPT   now though.
but before it was  2.6.15-26-server #1 SMP
ah you were running the server kernel
sorry I clearly know less than you :) try in #ubuntu-kernel
no prob, thanks.
